intro: Ptycanthera ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved ptycanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Ptycanthera ovatifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
